thread.title: Harvard baseball team's new talent? Singing
thread.title_full: Harvard baseball team's new talent? Singing - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Harvard baseball team's new talent? Singing
text:
connerhulse via YouTube The Harvard baseball team performs a dance routine to the song "Call me Maybe". Members of the Harvard baseball team are showing off a newfound talent in a quick-to-go-viral video.
The video, which appears to be filmed on the team van, shows teammates Jeff Reynolds , Steven Dill , Andrew Ferreira , Marcus Way , Kyle Larrow , Jon Smart and Joey Novak rocking out to Carly Rae Jepsen ’s song “Call Me Maybe”.
The stonefaced baseball players perform a simple dance routine as their teammate, Jack Colton , sleeps in the back.
“Yes, he was actually sleeping the whole time,” Conner Hulse wrote on YouTube.
The video, posted last weekend, has gotten rave reviews from around the Internet — including their own school newspaper.
“Baseball team, we hope you had a good time putting the video together, and thank you for the much-needed finals period entertainment,” The Crimson said in its sports blog.
The Crimson finished the Ivy League season with a 8-12 conference and 12-30 overall record.
But they seem to have won over many fans — at least on YouTube.
“You should do that in the middle of a game,” one commenter said.
“Way to start my day! Thanks fellows!!!” another wrote.
